Exaggerate: The claim made by Joe Biden that a different pandemic response from President Trump would have prevented every coronavirus death is seen as an exaggeration by experts.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as experts state that it is impossible to say that every life could have been saved with a different response.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that if the president had done his job differently, all the people would still be alive, which experts find problematic.
Exist alternative explanation: Experts suggest that a more robust handling of the pandemic would have significantly reduced the death count, but they also point out that achieving zero deaths would have been difficult regardless of who is in charge.
